member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture
member.summary: Defines values for the set of available application-specific gestures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.AllGestures
member.summary: Recognizes all application-specific gestures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.ArrowDown
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The arrow can be drawn in a single stroke or in two strokes where one stroke is the line and the other is the arrow head. Do not use more than two strokes to draw the arrow.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.ArrowLeft
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The arrow can be drawn in a single stroke or in two strokes where one stroke is the line and the other is the arrow head. Do not use more than two strokes to draw the arrow.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.ArrowRight
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The arrow can be drawn in a single stroke or in two strokes where one stroke is the line and the other is the arrow head. Do not use more than two strokes to draw the arrow.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.ArrowUp
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The arrow can be drawn in single stroke or in two strokes where one stroke is the line and the other is the arrow head. Do not use more than two strokes to draw the arrow.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Check
member.summary: Denotes a check-off. The upward stroke must be twice as long as the smaller downward stroke.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.ChevronDown
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. Both sides of the chevron must be drawn as equal as possible. The angle must be sharp and end in a point.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.ChevronLeft
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. Both sides of the chevron must be drawn as equal as possible. The angle must be sharp and end in a point.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.ChevronRight
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. Both sides of the chevron must be drawn as equal as possible. The angle must be sharp and end in a point.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.ChevronUp
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. Both sides of the chevron must be drawn as equal as possible. The angle must be sharp and end in a point.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Circle
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The circle must be drawn in a single stroke without lifting the pen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Curlicue
member.summary: Cuts a word. Start the curlicue on the word you intend to cut.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.DoubleCircle
member.summary: Pastes a selection. The two circles must overlap each other and be drawn in a single stroke without lifting the pen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.DoubleCurlicue
member.summary: Copies a word. Start the double-curlicue on the word you intend to copy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.DoubleTap
member.summary: Signifies a mouse double-click. The two taps must be made quickly to result in the least amount of slippage and the least duration between taps. In addition, the taps must be as close to each other as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Down
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn as a single fast flick in the downward direction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.DownLeft
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the down stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.DownLeftLong
member.summary: Signifies pressing an ENTER key. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the down stroke. The left stroke is about twice as long as the up stroke, and the two strokes must be at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.DownRight
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the down stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.DownRightLong
member.summary: Signifies pressing the spacebar. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the down stroke. The right stroke must be about twice as long as the up stroke, and the two strokes must be at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.DownUp
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the down stroke. The two strokes must be as close to each other as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Exclamation
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The line must be drawn first and then the dot drawn quickly and as close to the line as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Left
member.summary: Specifies a backspace. This gesture must be drawn as a single fast flick to the left.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.LeftDown
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the left stroke. The two sides are as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.LeftRight
member.summary: Cuts a selection. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the left stroke. The two strokes must be as close to each other as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.LeftUp
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the left stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.NoGesture
member.summary: Recognizes no application-specific gestures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Right
member.summary: Signifies a space. This gesture must be drawn as a single fast flick to the right.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.RightDown
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the right stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.RightLeft
member.summary: Copies a selection. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the right stroke. The two strokes must be as close to each other as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.RightUp
member.summary: Signifies an Input Method Editor (IME) convert. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the right stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Scratchout
member.summary: Erases content. This gesture must be drawn as a single stroke that has at least three back-and-forth motions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.SemiCircleLeft
member.summary: Undoes an action. The semicircle must be drawn from left to right. The two ends of the semicircle should be as horizontally even as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.SemiCircleRight
member.summary: Redoes an action. The semicircle must be drawn from right to left. The two ends of the semicircle should be as horizontally even as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Square
member.summary: Marks an action item. The square can be drawn in one or two strokes. In one stroke, draw the entire square without lifting the pen. In two strokes, draw three sides of the square and use another stroke to draw the remaining side. Do not use more than two strokes to draw the square.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Star
member.summary: Marks an action item. The star must have exactly five points and be drawn in a single stroke without lifting the pen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Tap
member.summary: Signifies a mouse click. For the least amount of slippage, the tap must be made quickly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Triangle
member.summary: Inserts input. The triangle must be drawn in a single stroke, without lifting the pen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.Up
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn as a single fast flick in the upward direction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.UpDown
member.summary: Undoes an action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the up stroke. The two strokes must be as close to each other as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.UpLeft
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the up stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.UpLeftLong
member.summary: Decreases the indent. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the up stroke. The left stroke must be about twice as long as the up stroke, and the two strokes must be at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.UpRight
member.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the up stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.ApplicationGesture.UpRightLong
member.summary: Signifies pressing a TAB key. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the up stroke. The right stroke must be about twice as long as the up stroke, and the two strokes must be at a right angle.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.BoundingBoxMode
member.summary: Specifies which characteristics of a stroke, such as drawing attributes, are used to calculate the bounding box of the ink.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.BoundingBoxMode.CurveFit
member.summary: Use the Bezier curve fitting line of the strokes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.BoundingBoxMode.Default
member.summary: Use the definition of each stroke.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.BoundingBoxMode.NoCurveFit
member.summary: Use the polyline of the strokes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.BoundingBoxMode.PointsOnly
member.summary: Use only the points of the strokes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.BoundingBoxMode.Union
member.summary: The union of and request.

member.summary: Provides data for cancelable mouse events.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Set to true to cancel the event for the parent control; otherwise false.
The number of times the mouse button was pressed and released.

The y-coordinate, in pixels, of a mouse click.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the mouse event is canceled for the parent control.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.CollectionMode
member.summary: Defines values that determine whether ink, gestures, or ink and gestures are recognized as the user writes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.CollectionMode.GestureOnly
member.summary: Collects only gestures and does not create a stroke. Gestures can be either single- or multi-stroke. Multi-stroke gestures are accepted if the strokes are made within the time set by the built-in timer of the recognizer. All stroke-related and packet-related events do not fire from the object, object, or control. Cursor events fire, and ink is always deleted. The , , or event interest is set to true, meaning that gestures are collected (all other event interests remain as they were).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.CollectionMode.InkAndGesture
member.summary: Accepts only single-stroke gestures. The , , or event fires first, allowing you to cancel or accept the event. The default is to accept the event, except when the NoGesture value from , is the primary gesture. If the gesture is accepted, the ink is deleted. If the gesture is canceled, the stroke is not deleted and a , , or event fires. The , , or event interest is set to true, meaning that gestures are collected (all other event interests remain as they were).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.CollectionMode.InkOnly
member.summary: Collects only ink, creating a stroke. The , , or event interest is set to false, meaning that gestures are not collected (all other event interests remain as they were).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.CompressionMode
member.summary: Defines values for the compression modes that are used to save the object to a serialized format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.CompressionMode.Default
member.summary: The default compression used to save ink. This is equivalent to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.CompressionMode.Maximum
member.summary: Maximizes compression, thereby minimizing required storage space. The ink takes longer to save. Use this mode when memory is at a premium.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.CompressionMode.NoCompression
member.summary: Minimizes the time to save the ink. This mode requires more storage space. Use this compression mode when compatibility between versions is important.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.CursorButtonState
member.summary: Defines values that specify the state of a cursor button.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.CursorButtonState.Down
member.summary: Shows that the cursor button is down. A button on a pen tip is down when the user lowers the pen to the digitizer and draws a stroke. For a button on a barrel, the button is down when the button is depressed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.CursorButtonState.Unavailable
member.summary: Shows that the cursor button is unavailable. A cursor button may become unavailable, for example, when a cursor leaves the range of the Tablet PC.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.CursorButtonState.Up
member.summary: Shows that the cursor button is up. A button on a pen tip is up when the pen is not pressed against the digitizer. A button on a pen barrel is up when the button is not depressed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Ink.HitTest(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the collection contained within a known Rectanglehttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemdrawingrectangleclasstopic.asp.
member.returns: The collection contained within the specified area.
member.param: The percentage value that determines which objects are included in the collection. objects that intersect the rectangle are included in the collection if the percentage of points in those objects contained within the rectangle is greater than or equal to the percentage passed in to the percentIntersect parameter.
The selection rectangle, in ink space coordinates.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Ink.HitTest(System.Drawing.Point[],System.Single,System.Drawing.Point[]@)
member.summary: Returns the collection contained within a polyline selection boundary.
member.returns: The collection contained within the specified area.
member.param: The points that are used in the selection boundary to select the objects. The selection area is the area inside the selection boundary in which the boundary first intersects itself.

When this method returns, contains an out parameter that represents the specific portion of the selection boundary that is used for the selection. Because a user can draw many differently shaped boundaries, some of which overlap multiple times, this can be useful for illustrating which portion of the boundary is used for selection. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Percentage by which the intersection must overlap to be a hit.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats
member.summary: Defines values that specify the format of ink that is stored on the Clipboard. This enumeration has a FlagsAttributehttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemflagsattributeclasstopic.asp attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats.Bitmap
member.summary: Specifies the bitmap to use as the background. The bitmap device context must remain valid for as long as it is used to render the ink background.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats.CopyMask
member.summary: Specifies the formats that are copied to the Clipboard through ink.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats.Default
member.summary: The format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats.EnhancedMetafile
member.summary: Specifies the enhanced metafile to play to create the background. The metafile must remain valid for as long as it is used to render the ink background.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats.InkSerializedFormat
member.summary: Specifies ink is encoded in Ink Serialized Format (ISF). This is the most compact persistent representation of ink. Although it often contains only ink data, Ink Serialized Format (ISF) is extensible. Applications can set custom attributes (identified by a globally unique identifier (GUID)) on an object, stroke, or point. This allows an application to store any kind of data or metadata it requires as an attribute in an Ink Serialized Format (ISF) stream.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats.Metafile
member.summary: Specifies ink is stored as a metafile or a list of commands that can be played back to draw a graphic.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats.None
member.summary: Specifies a flag that can be used to verify whether any formats are present by checking against it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats.PasteMask
member.summary: Specifies the formats that can be used for pasting.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats.SketchInk
member.summary: Specifies ink is not expected to form words, but rather is interpreted as a picture. This is also useful for representing multiple words.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardFormats.TextInk
member.summary: Specifies ink is expected to form words. It allows the ink to be converted to text. The recognized text is either the alternate with the greatest confidence rating or another alternate chosen from a list. This is useful for representing a single word.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardModes
member.summary: Defines values that specify the copy options of the Clipboard. This enumeration has a FlagsAttributehttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemflagsattributeclasstopic.asp attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardModes.Copy
member.summary: Copies the ink to the Clipboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardModes.Cut
member.summary: Cuts the ink and copies it to the Clipboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardModes.Default
member.summary: The mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardModes.DelayedCopy
member.summary: Uses delayed rendering to reduce the amount of data that is stored on the Clipboard. The data is rendered when a paste request is made.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.InkClipboardModes.ExtractOnly
member.summary: Does not copy the ink to the Clipboard. Typically, use this option if you want to add something else, such as text, to the ink before you copy it to the Clipboard.

member.summary: Defines values that specify the shape of the pen tip.

member.summary: Specifies a round pen tip.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.PersistenceFormat
member.summary: Defines values that specify how ink is persisted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.PersistenceFormat.Base64Gif
member.summary: Specifies ink that is persisted by using a base64 encoded fortified Graphics Interchange Format (GIF). This format is provided when ink is to be encoded directly in an Extensible Markup Language (XML) or HTML file with later conversion into an image. A possible use of this is in an Extensible Markup Language (XML) format that is generated to contain all ink information and used as a way to generate HTML through Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations (XSLT).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.PersistenceFormat.Base64InkSerializedFormat
member.summary: Specifies ink that is persisted by encoding the ink serialized format (ISF) as a base64 stream. This format is provided so ink can be encoded directly in an Extensible Markup Language (XML) or HTML file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.PersistenceFormat.Gif
member.summary: Specifies ink that is persisted by using a Graphics Interchange Format (GIF) file that contains Ink Serialized Format (ISF) as metadata embedded within the file. This allows ink to be viewed in applications that are not ink-enabled and maintain its full ink fidelity when it returns to an ink-enabled application. This format is ideal when transporting ink content within an HTML file and making it usable by ink-enabled and ink-unaware applications.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.PersistenceFormat.InkSerializedFormat
member.summary: Specifies ink that is persisted using Ink Serialized Format (ISF). This is the most compact persistent representation of ink. It can be embedded within a binary document format or placed directly on the Clipboard.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.RasterOperation

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RasterOperation.MergeNotPen
member.summary: Specifies a combination of the display color and the inverse of the pen color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RasterOperation.MergePen
member.summary: Specifies a combination of the pen color and the display color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RasterOperation.MergePenNot
member.summary: Specifies a combination of the pen color and the inverse of the display color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RasterOperation.NoOperation
member.summary: Specifies no operation; the output remains unchanged.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RasterOperation.Not
member.summary: Specifies the inverse of the display color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionConfidence.Poor
member.summary: Indicates poor confidence in the result or alternate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionConfidence.Strong
member.summary: Indicates strong confidence in the result or alternate.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionModes
member.summary: Defines values that specify how the recognizer interprets the ink and determines the result string. This enumeration has a FlagsAttributehttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemflagsattributeclasstopic.aspFlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionModes.AutoSpace
member.summary: Specifies the recognizer should perform auto-spacing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionModes.Coerce
member.summary: Specifies that the recognizer coerces the result based on the factoid that you specified for the context. For example, if the factoid is specified and the user enters the word hello, the recognizer may return a random phone number or an empty string. If this flag is not specified, the recognizer returns hello as the result. Input scopes and factoids are restrictions on the word level alternates; character alternates may be outside the input scope specified even when COERCE is on.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionModes.DisablePersonalization
member.summary: Disables personalization on the recognizer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionModes.LineMode
member.summary: Specifies that no line breaking occurs inside the recognizer and all of the ink is recognized as one line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionModes.None
member.summary: Specifies that the recognizer applies no recognition modes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionModes.PrefixOk
member.summary: Apply partial word recognition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionModes.TopInkBreaksOnly
member.summary: Disables multiple segmentation. This turns off the recognizer's ability to return recognition results based on more than one recognition segment of the ink, where each segment corresponds to a word (in recognizers of Latin script) or a character (in recognizers of East Asian characters). The word "together" always returns alternates based on "together" being a single word, and the recognizer does not consider the string might also be "to get her" or some other variation with differing segmentation. Turning on this flag enhances recognition speed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionModes.WordMode
member.summary: Specifies that the recognizer treats the ink as a single word. For example, if the context contains "to get her", the recognizer returns "together".

member.summary: Returns the collection from a range within the best result string of the object, so that each object in the collection corresponds to only one segment of ink. The returned collection is limited to 10 elements.
member.returns: Returns the collection from a selection within the best result string of the object, so that each object in the collection corresponds to only one segment of ink.
member.param: The start of the text selection from which the collection is returned. The default value is 0 (zero).
The length of the text selection from which the collection is returned. The default value is –1, which specifies the text beginning from the start of the selection to the end of the string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionResult.GetAlternatesFromSelection(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the collection from a range within the best result string of the object, so that each object in the collection corresponds to only one segment of ink. The returned collection is limited to a specified size.
member.returns: Returns the collection from a selection within the best result string of the object, so that each object in the collection corresponds to only one segment of ink.
member.param: The start of the text selection from which the collection is returned. The default value is 0 (zero).

The maximum number of alternates to return. The default value is 10. Recognizers that cannot compute the number of alternates, because of degree of difficulty or length of time, return an arbitrary number of alternates.
The length of the text selection from which the collection is returned. The default value is –1, which specifies the text beginning from the start of the selection to the end of the string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities
member.summary: Defines values that specify the attributes of a recognizer. Use this enumeration to determine which attributes to use when searching for an installed recognizer. This enumeration has a FlagsAttributehttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemflagsattributeclasstopic.asp attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.AdviseInkChange
member.summary: Specifies that the recognizer's background recogition can be interrupted, as in when the ink has changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.ArbitraryAngle
member.summary: Specifies the recognizer supports text is written at arbitrary angles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.BoxedInput
member.summary: Specifies the recognizer supports boxed input, in which each character or word is entered in a box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.CharacterAutoCompletionInput
member.summary: Specifies the recognizer supports character Autocomplete. Recognizers that support character Autocomplete require boxed input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.DontCare
member.summary: Ignores all other flags that are set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.DownAndLeft
member.summary: Specifies the recognizer supports Asian languages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.DownAndRight
member.summary: Specifies the recognizer supports the Chinese language.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.FreeInput
member.summary: Specifies the recognizer supports free input. ink is entered without the use of a recognition guide, such as lines or boxes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.Lattice
member.summary: Specifies the recognizer can return a lattice object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.LeftAndDown
member.summary: Specifies that the recognizer supports Hebrew and Arabic languages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.LinedInput
member.summary: Specifies the recognizer supports lined input, which is similar to writing on lined paper.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.Object
member.summary: If set, specifies the recognizer performs object recognition; otherwise, the recognizer performs text recognition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.Personalizable
member.summary: Specifies that the recognizer supports personalization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.RightAndDown
member.summary: Specifies the recognizer supports western and Asian languages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCapabilities.StrokeReorder
member.summary: Specifies that stroke order — spatial and temporal — is handled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCharacterAutoCompletionMode
member.summary: Defines values that specify types of character input modes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCharacterAutoCompletionMode.Full
member.summary: Specifies recognition occurs as if all strokes have been input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCharacterAutoCompletionMode.Prefix
member.summary: Specifies recognition occurs on partial input. The order of the strokes must conform to the rules of the language.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.RecognizerCharacterAutoCompletionMode.Random
member.summary: Specifies recognition occurs on partial input. The order of the strokes can be arbitrary.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.Stroke
member.summary: Represents a single ink stroke. A stroke is a set of properties and point data that the digitizer captures that represent the coordinates and properties of a known ink mark. It is the set of data that is captured in a single pen down, up, or move sequence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Stroke.Clip(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Removes the portions of the object that are outside a given rectangle.
member.param: The rectangle outside of which each object is clipped.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Stroke.FindIntersections(Microsoft.Ink.Strokes)
member.summary: Finds the points where this object intersects other objects within a given collection.
member.returns: This method returns an array of floating point index values that indicate the locations where the intersections occur.A floating point index is a float value that represents a location somewhere between two points in the object. As examples, if 0.0 is the first point in the stroke and 1.0 is the second point in the stroke, 0.5 is halfway between the first and second points. Similarly, a floating point index value of 37.25 represents a location that is 25 percent along the line between points 37 and 38 of the stroke.
member.param: The collection used to test for intersections with this object. If null (Nothing in Microsoft® Visual Basic® .NET), uses all collections in the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Stroke.GetBoundingBox
member.summary: Returns the bounding Rectanglehttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemdrawingrectangleclasstopic.asp that defines the bounding box for the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Stroke.GetBoundingBox(Microsoft.Ink.BoundingBoxMode)
member.summary: Returns the bounding Rectanglehttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemdrawingrectangleclasstopic.asp that contains the object, by using the specified flag to determine the bounds.
member.returns: Returns the bounding Rectanglehttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemdrawingrectangleclasstopic.asp that defines the bounding box for the object.
member.param: A member of the enumeration that specifies which characteristics of a object, such as drawing attributes, are used to calculate the bounding box of the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Stroke.GetFlattenedBezierPoints

member.returns: Returns a Pointhttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemdrawingpointclasstopic.asp array that indicates the points that were used to draw the Bezier curve representation of the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Stroke.GetFlattenedBezierPoints(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the array of points that are used to approximate the Bezier representation of a object with the specified fitting error.
member.returns: Returns a Pointhttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemdrawingpointclasstopic.asp array that indicates the points that were used to draw the Bezier curve representation of the object.
member.param: The maximum distance (accuracy), in HIMETRIC units, between the Bezier control points and the points of the object. This is also known as the curve fitting error level.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Stroke.GetPacketData
member.summary: Returns the packet data for all packets in the object.
member.returns: Returns a signed 32-bit integer array containing the packet data for the requested points in the object. The array contains the data for the first point, then the data for the second point, and so on.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Stroke.GetPacketData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the packet data for one packet, at a specified index, within the object.
member.returns: Returns a signed 32-bit integer array containing the packet data for the requested points in the object. The array contains the data for the first point, then the data for the second point, and so on.
member.param: The starting point of the zero-based index to a packet within the stroke.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.Stroke.GetPacketData(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the packet data for a range of packets within the object.
member.returns: Returns a signed 32-bit integer array containing the packet data for the requested points in the object. The array contains the data for the first point, then the data for the second point, and so on.
member.param: The number of point packet data sets to return, starting with the packet specified in the index parameter.
The starting point of the zero-based index to a packet within the stroke.

member.summary: Returns the metrics for a given packet description type.
member.returns: Returns the metrics for a given packet description type.
member.param: The Guidhttp://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemguidclasstopic.asp from the object, which identifies the property for which to obtain metrics.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Ink.SystemGesture
member.summary: Defines values that set the interest in a set of operating system-specific gesture. The Microsoft® Windows® XP Tablet PC Edition operating system supports these gestures by default. When any of these gestures are recognized, the , , or event fires automatically. Many of these gestures map to traditional mouse events. For instance, the Tap system gesture mimics a single left-click on a mouse.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.SystemGesture.DoubleTap
member.summary: Maps to a double-click on a mouse. This can be used to select a word or open a file or folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.SystemGesture.Drag
member.summary: Maps to a left drag on a mouse. This can be used to drag-select (such as in Microsoft® Word when starting with an insertion point), select multiple words, drag (such as when dragging an object in Microsoft® Windows®), or scroll.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.SystemGesture.HoldEnter
member.summary: Specifies a left click for a long time, which has no mouse equivalent. This is a fallback for when a user continues a press-and-hold action for a long time and the event reverts to a Tap.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.SystemGesture.HoldLeave
member.summary: Not implemented.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.SystemGesture.HoverEnter
member.summary: Maps to a mouse hover. This can be used to show a ToolTip roll-over effects or other mouse hover behaviors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.SystemGesture.HoverLeave
member.summary: Maps to a mouse leaving a hover. This can be used to end ToolTip roll-over effects or other mouse hover behaviors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.SystemGesture.RightDrag
member.summary: Specifies a press and hold followed by a stroke, which maps to a right drag on a mouse. This can be used to drag (such as when dragging an object or selection followed by a shortcut menu).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.SystemGesture.RightTap
member.summary: Maps to a right-click on a mouse. This can be used to show a shortcut menu.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Ink.SystemGesture.Tap
member.summary: Maps to a left-click on a mouse. This can be used to choose a command from the menu or toolbar, take action if a command is chosen, set an insertion point, or show selection feedback.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.TextInput.HandwrittenTextInsertion.InsertInkRecognitionResult(Microsoft.Ink.RecognitionResult,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Insert recognition results.
member.param: The for the insertion which contains the recognition results and the collection of ink strokes for the insertion.
A specific culture for the input language of the recognizer used to produce alternates.
Specifies whether the recognized text was generated with auto-spacing enabled on the recognized. true if auto-spacing was enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Ink.TextInput.HandwrittenTextInsertion.InsertRecognitionResultsArray(System.String[][],System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Insert recognition results array.
member.param: A specific culture for the input language of the recognizer used to produce alternates.

A two-dimensional array of strings, where each entry in the first array is a list of alternates for a single word. The first entry in the sub arrays of alternates is the text to insert (the top alternate).

Specifies whether the recognized text was generated with auto-spacing enabled on the recognized. When false, a space at the start/end of the lattice will always get inserted, if present. When true, a space being present means we will add a space if necessary, space not being present means we will consume a space if present.
